business.headline: Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Will top IT companies gain momentum in Q1FY26?Equirus Securities, in its earnings preview, signals a subdued performance for the sector, where even the heavyweights are struggling to regain momentum.

Mutual fund inflows rise 24% in June to Rs 23,587 crore: AMFI dataAmong the 11 equity mutual fund categories, all except equity-linked savings schemes (ELSS) recorded positive inflows. Flexi cap funds emerged as the most preferred option for investors, bringing in Rs 5,733 crore in June.

9 countries where Indians can get citizenship for less than Rs 1 croreAcross many countries, it is now fully legal to buy citizenship. With a single payment or donation, Indians can get a fresh passport that offers visa-free access and minimal global taxes.

ICICI Prudential Asset Management files for IPO. Check offer detailsThe IPO will be an offer for sale of up to 1.77 crore shares, representing 10% of the company's equity share capital. The shares will be sold by Prudential Corporation Holdings Limited (PCHL), a wholly-owned subsidiary of UK-based insurer Prudential.
Crizac IPO listing: Shares debut at 14% premium on Dalal StreetCrizac share price: The stock opened at Rs 280 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) showing a 14.29% premium on its Dalal Street debut.

Will Rs 2,000 SIP make you rich? CA breaks it downMany young investors trust SIPs to secure their future but without clear goals, even long-term discipline might not be enough, warns CA and financial planning advisor Abhishek Walia.

Studying abroad? Here's how you can manage your finances smartlyStudying abroad is a huge step, and an amazing opportunity. But a bit of smart financial planning can help you enjoy every moment without money worries.
Sensex opens 130 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 158.94 points to 83,553.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.70 points to 25,480.80 as of 9:30 am.

Wolfspeed shares surge 248% in 5 days. What's powering this Nasdaq stock?Wolfspeed shares opened with a 43% jump on Tuesday over the previous day's close of $1.18 and reached an intraday high of $3.33. The stock ended the day at $2.52, up 9%.

Who is Sabih Khan? Apple's new COO overtaking Jeff WilliamsThe announcement came on Tuesday, with the company confirming that Sabih Khan will step into the role later this month. He takes over from Jeff Williams, who has held the post since 2015.

RCB overtakes CSK as IPL's most valuable team, league now worth $18.5 billionA report released by investment bank Houlihan Lokey said the IPL's business value rose by 13% in 2025 to $18.5 billion. At the same time, the brand value of the league increased by 14% to nearly $4 billion.

India, US hopeful of inking trade deal, but New Delhi firm on protecting key sectorsIndia and the United States are nearing a trade deal, with negotiations ongoing. India has taken a firm stance on protecting sensitive sectors, particularly wheat, maize, dairy, and genetically grown crops.

Will central government employees' dearness allowance reach 60%?The government revises the DA/DR rates twice a year, effective from January 1 and July 1. However, the official announcement generally comes a few months later.
Sensex closes 271 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 270 points to end at 83,712.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 61.20 points to close at 25,522.50.

Fincluencer explains why India's rich are planning to retire abroadIndia's rich are rethinking where they retire and how they invest. Finfluencer Akshat Shrivastava says it's not a whim but a calculated response to India's tax structure on wealth and income.

Earning Rs 80,000 a month and still broke? Finance coach explains what's wrongMany in their 20s and 30s are earning more than generations before, but their money often disappears into lifestyle upgrades, digital conveniences, and impulse-driven choices. The result is a sense of helplessness despite a good paycheck.

Bill Gates no longer in world's top 10 richest; trails former Microsoft CEOBill Gates now ranks behind Michael Dell, who is at number 11 with $137 billion, and Steve Ballmer, his former Microsoft colleague, who is far ahead at number 5 with $172 billion.

All you need to know about UAE's Golden Visa: Cost, application, documentationUnlike earlier Golden Visas that required big investments in property or business, this new scheme allows skilled professionals to apply based on their talent and work experience.

Jane Street vs Sebi: All you need to know about the caseAt the heart of the controversy is a long-running investigation into the firm's index arbitrage strategy, one that Jane Street insists is standard and legal, but which Sebi believes may have distorted prices in India's rapidly growing equity derivatives market.
Filed your ITR early? Will you get a faster tax refund?Filing an ITR early improves your chances of a quicker refund, but only if your return is correct, complete and verified on time.
Insured, but still deniedIn Part 2 of our series on India's insurance crisis, we explore why, for thousands of Indians, having a policy doesn't mean having protection when it matters most.

Jane Street to challenge Sebi trading ban, slams charges as inflammatory: ReportIn an internal email to staff over the weekend, the US-based firm said it was "beyond disappointed" by Sebi's accusations, which it described as "extremely inflammatory."

Have lost their tax edge: Expert sounds the alarm on ULIPsThe tax expert said ULIPs no longer guarantee tax-free returns. Investors paying over Rs 2.5 lakh annually may face capital gains tax—making mutual funds a more efficient alternative.
Sensex opens 65 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Kotak Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 72.04 points to 83,514.54, while the NSE Nifty50 added 16.50 points to 25,477.80 as of 9:40 am.

Market opening: How will Sensex, Nifty react to Trump's tariff announcement?While a US-India trade deal may help improve mood, the benefits may be limited to specific sectors. For today's session, Nifty to find support between 25,330 and 25,180 and face resistance near 25,510 and 25,630, say experts.

Trump's tariff list: 14 countries, new rates, and what they export to AmericaUS President Donald Trump confirmed that letters had been sent to several nations, warning them that if new trade agreements are not reached by August 1, increased import duties will be implemented.

Necktie Nomics: Can the RBI Governor's tie colour predict rate moves?An SBI report looked at the ties worn by the RBI Governor during Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meetings. Instead of only watching inflation numbers or GDP data, they turned their attention to the shades of silk draped around the Governor's neck.
Sensex ends flat, Nifty below 25,500; HUL gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 9.61 points higher at 83,442.50, while the NSE Nifty remained flat to end below 25,500.
GCCs push India's office leasing to new heights: ReportGCCs are no longer coming to India just for cheaper costs. They now see India as a strong base for talent, innovation and large modern offices.

Sebi to intensify watch on derivatives trading after Jane Street episodeIndia is currently the world's largest equity derivatives market. According to the Futures Industry Association, it accounted for nearly 60% of the derivatives contracts traded globally in April.

EMIs hurt India's middle class more than inflation, says financial expertToday, almost everything is available on easy monthly instalments, from a new phone to flight tickets, even groceries. What was once a helpful option has now turned into a lifestyle. However, this is silently eating into people's income, leaving little room for savings or emergencies.

Filing ITR for the first time? 7 common errors new taxpayers must avoidFiling your ITR is not enough. You must verify it too. If you forget, the tax department treats it as if you never filed it at all. You can e-verify using Aadhaar OTP, net banking, or by sending a signed physical copy. Without verification, your return stays incomplete.

House rent above Rs 50,000? Here's the TDS rule you need to knowFor tenants living in high-rent homes, the line between a routine payment and a tax lapse can be thinner than it seems, and ignoring it can invite penalties that quickly snowball.

HUL shares gain 2% today. Should you buy the FMCG stock?HUL share price: The stock has gained 3.67% in the last five trading sessions. However, when looking at a longer time frame, the stock is still down 7.97% over the past year.

Lost Rs 18 lakh in 6 months: Financial advisor's warning on online bettingWhat begins as casual fun can spiral into secrecy, debt, and broken trust. A financial advisor warns that, without strong regulation, betting apps are fast becoming one of India's biggest financial threats.

Tariffs on steel, auto unlikely in interim trade deal with US: Government sourcesWith the US to soon notify countries of higher tariffs by July 9, with new rates effective August 1, sectoral levies on steel, auto and aluminium are unlikely in the India-US interim trade deal, government sources said.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 65.28 points to 83,367.61, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 16.45 points to 25,444.55 as of 9:50 am.

Trump reveals tariff letter plan with a twist: Here's what's coming nextTrump also said that any country supporting what he called the 'Anti-American policies' of the BRICS group will face an additional 10% tariff.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty fall as Trump singals delay in tariffs?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,512 as of 8:08 am., suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open around its previous close of 25,461. Sensex and Nifty declined by 0.7% each last week.

The stark irony of world's 4th largest economy with 81 crore free-mealersIndia's growing wealth gap often sparks despair, but the author, a retired ESIC Regional Director, argues the real solution lies in enforcing India's long-ignored labour laws.

entertainment.headline: Shashwat Singh on singing Zamaana Lage with Arijit Singh: It was a market callShashwat Singh shares insights on recording romantic tracks for Metro... In Dino and working alongside Arijit Singh. He discusses Bollywood's love song revival and improvements in royalty distribution.

Fear can't keep language alive: Janhvi's partner Shikhar on Marathi-Hindi rowActor Janhvi Kapoor's partner Shikhar Pahariya commented on the Hindi-Marathi language row in Maharashtra. He advocated for inclusion and dignity for all language speakers in a social media post.

Exclusive: Sonakshi Sinha says romantic scenes are more challenging than actionSonakshi Sinha revealed that while action scenes are physically tough, romantic sequences make her feel most self-conscious on screen. She also shared her admiration for actors Hrithik Roshan, Aamir Khan, and Vidya Balan.

K-pop group KATSEYE announces first-ever BEAUTIFUL CHAOS tour. Dates, cities outK-pop girl group KATSEYE has announced their first-ever 'BEAUTIFUL CHAOS' Tour. The tour is scheduled to kick off on November 15 this year.

Ancient roofs, sunset, royal homes in Kartik Aaryan's Nawalgarh photo-dumpActor Kartik Aaryan shared photos capturing Nawalgarh's charm on social media. He is shooting for his upcoming film 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri', which also stars Ananya Panday.

Actor who made his debut with television, now features in this Rs 1600 crore epicAn actor who was introduced to the performing arts at the age of seven, is now going to feature in India's most ambitious movie project. From working in popular Hindi television shows to acting alongside Priyanka Chopra and Deepika Padukone, he is not Shah Rukh Khan, Ranveer Singh or Shahid Kapoor.

Don't like long hours myself: Anurag Basu backs Deepika's 8-hour shift demand'Metro... In Dino' director Anurag Basu supported Deepika Padukone's eight-hour work shift demand. He explained his own approach to filmmaking, and highlighted that he himself doesn't like working for long hours.

Melbourne Film Festival to honour Guru Dutt with Pyaasa, Kaagaz Ke Phool screeningGuru Dutt's timeless tales 'Pyaasa' and 'Kaagaz Ke Phool' find new light at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne (IFFM), gearing up to relive the golden age of Indian cinema on the big screen.

Law and the City review: Lee Jong-suk's legal drama has more heart than hypeRelease Date:Sat Jul 05, 2025'Law and the City' is a nuanced legal drama that delves into the personal philosophies and everyday challenges of its characters beyond the courtroom. Featuring compelling performances by Lee Jong-suk and Moon Ka-young, the series explores themes of respect, growth, and friendship.

Hrithik Roshan enjoys movie date with Saba Azad as War 2 shoot comes to an endActor Hrithik Roshan and his girlfriend Saba Azad were seen exiting a cinema hall in Mumbai's Juhu on Tuesday. Their movie outing came after the wrap-up celebrations of Roshan's upcoming film 'War 2'.

Pedro Pascal leads fantastically stylish cast at Fantastic Four Berlin event. PicsPedro Pascal, Vanessa Kirby and the rest of the team of 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' attended a glitzy fan event in Berlin on Tuesday. Pascal, of course, looked every bit like the internet's favourite daddy that he is. Check out the pictures inside.

Nayanthara hit with Rs 5 crore notice for using Chandramukhi footage in documentaryThe controversy surrounding the Netflix documentary 'Nayanthara: Beyond The Fairytale' continues to escalate, with the latest development being a legal notice issued to the producers by the High Court.

Fake signature, Rs 77 lakh gone: Alia Bhatt's ex-staffer arrested for duping herActor Alia Bhatt's ex-personal assistant, Vedika Prakash Shetty, has been arrested on charges of allegedly swindling Rs 77 lakh from Bhatt's production house and her personal accounts.

Fans vouch for Abhishek Bachchan's performance on Dus 20th anniversary, Big B agreesVeteran actor Amitabh Bachchan praised son Abhishek's performance in 'Dus' as the film celebrated 20 years of release on Tuesday. Directed by Anubhav Sinha, 'Dus' was released in 2005.

Singer Yasser Desai in legal trouble for shooting song on Worli sea linkSinger and composer Yasser Desai has found himself in legal trouble after a video of him shooting a song on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link went viral.

Metro In Dino box office Day 5: Anurag Basu's film gets monsoon boost on weekdays'Metro... In Dino' collected more on Tuesday than Monday, which speaks about the growing word-of-mouth around its content. The Anurag Basu-directorial is running successfully in the metros.

Bad Girl: Controversial Tamil film on Brahmin portrayal censored, release date outDirector Varsha Bharath's Tamil film 'Bad Girl' will release in theatres in India on September 5. The film's teaser was criticised for its Brahmin portrayal and promoting alcoholism.

I'll be the man you are: Salman Khan to Atul Agnihotri in birthday wish postActor Salman Khan extended birthday wishes to filmmaker and his brother-in-law Atul Agnihotri with an adorable post on Instagram. He appreciated Atul's role as a husband and father in the sweet post.

Rajkummar Rao, Manushi Chillar seek blessings at Bangla Sahib before Maalik releaseRajkummar Rao and Manushi Chillar visited Bangla Sahib gurdwara ahead of the release of their upcoming film 'Maalik.' The film will release in theatres on July 11.

general news.headline: Aadhaar is never the first identity: UIDAI chief amid Bihar voter revision rowSpeaking exclusively to India Today, Kumar highlighted UIDAI's ongoing efforts to check the fake Aadhaar card industry, stating that Aadhaar cards have a built-in security mechanism through a QR code.

Bridge collapses in Gujarat, 9 dead as vehicles plunge, truck hangs by a threadGujarat Bridge Collapse: Preliminary information indicated at least five vehicles had fallen into the river after the bridge collapse. Following the incident, Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel immediately dispatched the Chief Engineer, bridge design team, and experts to the site and ordered a detailed report.

Should I worship one who serves poison? Sena MLA's brazen reply over punch videoShiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad said his actions were justified after a video of him thrashing a canteen operator at an MLA residence in Mumbai over the alleged poor quality of food went viral, stirring controversy.

Leaked audio hints Sheikh Hasina gave 'find-and-shoot' order on agitators: ReportAt least 1,400 people were killed in the crackdown in 2024 as Bangladesh was roiled by student protests over a controversial quota system in government jobs.

How even non-citizens get to vote in India. The devil lies in Form 6The Election Commission is holding an intensive revision of voter rolls across India, beginning with Bihar, to update them and weed out non-citizens. But why did India allow non-citizens to get into the rolls in the first place? Form 6, which people fill to register as voters, doesn't demand proof of citizenship in the first place.

Opinions can be wrong: US on India's objections to Pak truce claim by TrumpUS State Department spokesperson Tammy Bruce was firm on President Donald Trump's repeated claims about brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, saying that in the modern world where every event plays out in real-time, it is for people to analyse and form their own opinion instead of relying only on comments.

Let it be released: Supreme Court refuses to halt screening of Udaipur Files'Udaipur Files' is based on the murder case of Rajasthan-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal. One of the murder accused sought a stay on the movie's release on July 11.

Trains halted, roads blocked: INDIA bloc protests over Bihar voter roll revisionRahul Gandhi will join the protest march at 10 am in Patna against the Election Commission of India's Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, marching from the Income Tax office at Golambar to the Election Commission office. Tejashwi Yadav will also take part in the march.

Watch: PM Modi's beat drop moment as he drums his way into NamibiaPrime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived in Windhoek, Namibia, marking the final stop of his five-nation tour aimed at promoting the Global South. This visit, the first by an Indian Prime Minister to Namibia in 27 years, aims to strengthen India-Namibia relations.

Key focus areas include uranium exports to India, exploration of recent oil and gas discoveries in Namibia, and potential defence cooperation. The visit also highlights India's efforts to forge stronger ties with African nations. PM Modi's itinerary includes addressing a joint session of the Namibian parliament and receiving the country's highest civilian award.

The Prime Minister's five-nation tour, one of his longest foreign visits in recent years, began on July 2 and has included stops in Ghana, Trinidad and Tobago, Argentina, and Brazil.

Some poor things don't have experience in politics: Kanimozhi takes dig at VijayDMK MP Kanimozhi took a veiled dig at actor-politician Vijay, calling him inexperienced and unaware of governance basics. Her remarks come amid growing friction between the ruling DMK and Vijay's party, Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam.

Google brings AI Mode in Search to India: Ask anything, ask any wayGoogle has started rolling out its AI Mode in Search to users in India. However, the feature will initially be available only in English.

'Apne style se': Angry over dal, Sena MLA dishes out punches on canteen operatorThe incident happened at the Akashwani MLA residence. Sanjay Gaikwad claimed that the food - especially the dal - was of poor quality, and he felt unwell shortly after eating.
Deepinder Goyal reacts to ex-Zomato employee's post calling out poor customer supportZomato CEO Deepinder Goyal reacted to a former employee's X post criticising the platform's poor customer service.

Alcaraz dominates Norrie, Fritz knocks out Khachanov to advance to semisCarlos Alcaraz and Taylor Fritz sealed their berths in the semi-final of Wimbledon 2025 following their victories over Cameron Norrie and Karen Khachanov, respectively.

Fake signature, Rs 77 lakh gone: Alia Bhatt's ex-staffer arrested for duping herActor Alia Bhatt's ex-personal assistant, Vedika Prakash Shetty, has been arrested on charges of allegedly swindling Rs 77 lakh from Bhatt's production house and her personal accounts.

No place for double standards on terrorism: PM Modi's strong message in BrazilIndia and Brazil reaffirmed their united stance against terrorism, with PM Modi emphasizing zero tolerance and no double standards, indirectly calling out Pakistan and China for supporting terrorist activities.

Killer whales bring food to humans in rare moment caught on videoThese events, recorded in four different oceans, involved orcas approaching people on boats, in the water, and even standing on the shore with gifts ranging from fish and mammals to birds, invertebrates, and even seaweed.
It's a joy: Shubhanshu Shukla on doing science for India on Space StationSince his arrival on the ISS, astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla has been immersed in a packed schedule of scientific experiments.

Wiaan Mulder aborted Mission 400. Could any Indian batter do the same?South Africa's Wiaan Mulder was unbeaten on 367 when he declared the innings-despite having both the time and momentum to chase down Brian Lara's Test record. How many Indian cricketers would've done the same?

Assam BJP chief accused of cow scam: Public funds used, no delivery madeAccording to an RTI reply, 90 cows were given to seven 'public representatives' who were supposed to distribute them to local farmers. One of the recipients, BJP state chief Dilip Saikia, allegedly neither paid the full amount nor provided documentation for the return of the cows to the farmers he claimed were 'bought.'

Foreign artist sparks outrage after calling Indian jhoola a 'gothic swing'The foreign artist, who goes by the name Anne Chovy on X, was accused of cultural misrepresentation after posting an image of an elaborately carved wooden swing found in several Indian households.

Indian-origin doctor suspended in UK for forcefully using forceps to deliver babyAn Indian-origin consultant gynaecologist was suspended after being found guilty of serious professional misconduct. She pressured a first-time mother at a UK hospital to accept forceps delivery despite the patient's clear request for a C-section. The woman claimed she was left traumatised, and the forceps caused damage to her baby's head.

Apoorva Mukhija, Raj Kundra to Ram Kapoor: Tentative Bigg Boss 19 contestantsAs Bigg Boss 19 is fast approaching, a list featuring the probable contestants has been doing the rounds. Apoorva Mukhija, Raj Kundra, Ram Kapoor, Tanushree Dutta and several others are likely to be part of the Salman Khan-hosted show.

Meet Sabih Khan, the Moradabad-born executive set to become Apple's next COOSabih Khan, a Moradabad-born Apple veteran, is set to become the company's next COO, bringing decades of experience in operations, sustainability, and supply chain leadership to the role.

Only 2 cuts, use name with twist: Censor board's U-turn on Janaki Vs State of KeralaThe censor board on Wednesday retracted its initial demands for extensive edits to the film 'Janaki Vs State of Kerala', suggesting only two minor alterations for certification. The board also reversed its stand on using the name of Goddess Sita in the film.

She also shared her admiration for actors Hrithik Roshan, Aamir Khan, and Vidya Balan.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill has shown he can fill the boots of the 'Fab Four': Mark RamprakashFormer England cricketer Mark Ramprakash has praised Shubman Gill for his endurance, talent, and determination, stating that the young Indian captain has demonstrated his ability to step into the shoes of the legendary 'Fab Four' as their era draws to a close.

New Zealand's Allen ruled out of Zimbabwe T20I tri-series due to foot injuryNew Zealand opener Finn Allen has been ruled out of the Zimbabwe T20I tri-series due to a foot injury sustained in Major League Cricket. His absence poses a challenge for New Zealand as they prepare for the tri-series and MLC playoffs.

Fingers crossed for Archer's Test comeback at Lord's, says HussainFormer captain Nasser Hussain has voiced concerns over England's faltering bowling attack—and believes the return of Jofra Archer might be the spark they desperately need.

Virat Kohli talks Test retirement, bond with Yuvraj Singh at charity eventVirat Kohli opened up for the first time about his Test retirement at a charity event in London, joking about age and reflecting emotionally on his bond with Yuvraj Singh and India's new Test chapter.

Rishabh Pant should be compared with best Test batters, not Gilchrist: AshwinVeteran Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has weighed in on Rishabh Pant's batting approach in Test cricket, urging a shift in how the dynamic wicketkeeper-batter is assessed.

The Incredible Hulk: Nico's F1 Redemption is the life lesson we all needFifteen years. Two exits. Zero podiums — until Silverstone. Nico Hülkenberg's moment finally arrived, not with fireworks, but with rain, resilience, and redemption. A green car. A gritty drive. And the roar of destiny fulfilled.

The Indian captain has scored 585 runs in the first two Tests of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

Indian batting coach unfazed by green Lord's pitch, admits Jofra Archer's threatIndian batting coach Sitanshu Kotak has revealed that India are unfazed by the green Lord's surface, England have prepared for the third Test but acknowledged Jofra Archer's threat.

Zimbabwe pacer fined, handed demerit point for dangerous play in 2nd TestZimbabwe pacer Kundai Matigimu was fined 15 per cent of his match fee and handed a demerit point after his dangerous throw at Lhuan dre Pretorious on Day 1 of the 2nd Test.

Chris Woakes past his sell-date, Zak Crawley not doing enough: Geoffrey BoycottLegendary England batter Geoffrey Boycott tore into Chris Woakes and Zak Crawley following England's massive 336-run loss against India in the second Test at Edgbaston, Birmingham.

Day 9 Highlights: Alcaraz beats Norrie, Sabalenka and Fritz into semisWimbledon 2025 Day 9 Highlights: Carlos Alcaraz has dominated his way through to take the first set. Aryna Sabalenka and Taylor Fritz have punched their tickets to the semifinal in their respective divisions.

Virat Kohli compares playing at Wimbledon and Lord's: Centre court more intimidatingVirat Kohli finds playing at Wimbledon's Centre Court more intimidating than cricket stadiums. He praises tennis players' mental strength and says only India vs Pakistan games match such pressure.

Mbappe drops moral harassment case against PSG and seeks reconciliationKylian Mbappe has dropped the moral harassment case against Paris Saint-Germain, and the Frenchman seeks reconciliation with his former club.

Virat Kohli makes Wimbledon 2025 prediction: I want Novak Djokovic to winVirat Kohli, speaking from the Center Court at Wimbledon, backed Novak Djokovic to play Carlos Alcaraz in the men's singles final and beat the Spaniard for his 25th Grand Slam title.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
